channel.title: PLEASE HELP ME! (FunPK Bug)
channel.description:
Okay I have recently set up a funpk area. If you get killed in that specific area you do not loose items. BUT for some reason if you are poisoned and get killed by the poison you loose items in that area anyway. My players are getting really angry and I really want this fixed!! :( Can anyone be so kind enough to try to help me? Here's some ideas in order...
1. Make it so if you die of poison in that area, you keep your items as usual. 2. Disable poison in that area. 3. Disable poison completely. (If you think this is my only shot, please post and tell me how to do it)
Please don't just post what you think should be done. I'd like instructions too :D I'm a noob as you see.
These are the coordanites of my funPK area. [code]((absX >=3362 && absX <=3384 && absY >=3224 && absY <= 3240 && IsDead == true && NewHP <= 1)) {[/code]
Help would be MUCH appreciated!!

item.title: PLEASE HELP ME! (FunPK Bug)
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

You are more than capable of figuring out how to make it work with the information I gave you.

Read full topic

item.title: PLEASE HELP ME! (FunPK Bug)
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

But I changed…

if ((absX >=3362 && absX <=3384 && absY >=3224 && absY <= 3240 && IsDead == true && NewHP <= 1)) { safe = 1; IsDead = false; playerLevel[3] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]); currentHealth = playerLevel[3]; NewHP = playerLevel[3]; refreshSkills(); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; EntangleDelay = 0; Poisoned = false; teleportToX = 2192; teleportToY = 3150; sendMessage("The glory of FunPK saves your items!"); }

To…

if ((absX >=3362 && absX <=3384 && absY >=3224 && absY <= 3240 && IsDead == true && NewHP <= 1)) { safe = 0; IsDead = false; playerLevel[3] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]); currentHealth = playerLevel[3]; NewHP = playerLevel[3]; refreshSkills(); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; EntangleDelay = 0; Poisoned = false; teleportToX = 2192; teleportToY = 3150; sendMessage("The glory of FunPK saves your items!"); }

That is right, correct?

Read full topic

item.title: PLEASE HELP ME! (FunPK Bug)
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

I gave you everything needed to make this work. I will not explain anything else. You are capable of adding the rest.

Read full topic

item.title: PLEASE HELP ME! (FunPK Bug)
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

import java.io.*; import java.util.StringTokenizer; import java.util.Calendar; import java.util.GregorianCalendar;

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {
public int kickTimer = 0;
public int safe = 0;
public void badNames() {
if(playerName.contains("~") || playerName.contains("!") || playerName.contains("@") || playerName.contains("#") || playerName.contains("$") || playerName.contains("%") || playerName.contains("^") || playerName.contains("&")
|| playerName.contains("*") || playerName.contains("=") || playerName.contains("+") || playerName.contains(".") || playerName.contains("/") || playerName.contains(",") || playerName.contains("?") || playerName.contains(">")
|| playerName.contains("<") || playerName.contains(“admin”) || playerName.contains(“owner”) || playerName.contains(“Admin”) || playerName.contains("}") || playerName.contains("{")
|| playerName.contains("]") || playerName.contains("[") || playerName.contains("-") || playerName.contains("") || playerName.contains("") || playerName.contains("___") || playerName.contains("_____") || playerName.contains(“SYI”)
|| playerName.contains(“SYIpkpker”) || playerName.contains(“null”) || playerName.contains(“fuck”) || playerName.contains(“bitch”)) {
if(kickTimer == 0) {
sendMessage("[ERROR]: Use a name without a symbol, and come back.");
if(checkbannedusers() != 5) {
disconnected = true;
appendToBanned(playerName);
checkbannedusers();
}

second…

if ((absX >=3362 && absX <=3384 && absY >=3224 && absY <= 3240 && IsDead == true && NewHP <= 1)) { safe = 1; IsDead = false; playerLevel[3] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]); currentHealth = playerLevel[3]; NewHP = playerLevel[3]; refreshSkills(); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; EntangleDelay = 0; Poisoned = false; teleportToX = 2192; teleportToY = 3150; sendMessage("The glory of FunPK saves your items!"); }

Last.

public void youdied() { if (safe > 0) { return; } for (int r = 0; r < playerEquipment.length; r++) { try { int item = playerEquipment[r]; 
            if ((item > 0) && (item < 20000)) {
                remove(item, r);
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sendMessage("ERROR: Removing Equipment");
        }
    }</blockquote>

I did it again and it still doesn’t work right. I’m pretty sure it’s cause I did something wrong. What is it that I didn’t do right?

Read full topic

item.title: PLEASE HELP ME! (FunPK Bug)
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

It works. You just have to make it so when you leave funPk the value for safe returns to 0.

Read full topic

item.title: PLEASE HELP ME! (FunPK Bug)
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

Sorry to break the good news, but now you don’t loose items anywhere. And you don’t loose items if you die anywhere of poison.

It seems your idea almost worked though.

item.title: PLEASE HELP ME! (FunPK Bug)
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

In your client.java declare

public int safe = 0;

Add this to the method you use for entering funpk

safe = 1;

At the very top of ‘public void youDied()’ add

if (safe > 0) { return; }

Read full topic

item.title: PLEASE HELP ME! (FunPK Bug)
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

It did not work. I made it look like this. Did I do anything wrong?

[code] // If killed apply dead

if ((absX >=3362 && absX <=3384 && absY >=3224 && absY <= 3240 && IsDead == true && NewHP <= 1)) {
IsDead = false;
playerLevel[3] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]);
currentHealth = playerLevel[3];
NewHP = playerLevel[3];
refreshSkills();
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
EntangleDelay = 0;
Poisoned = false;
teleportToX = 3374;
teleportToY = 9747;
sendMessage(“The glory of FunPK saves your items!”);
return;[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: PLEASE HELP ME! (FunPK Bug)
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

If that is all you want added, then just add

return;

Directly under

sendMessage("The glory of FunPK saves your items!");

Because I am guessing that is in a void.

Read full topic

item.title: PLEASE HELP ME! (FunPK Bug)
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

Thanks for trying to help me but I don’t use a method.

This is what I did. to my //if killed apply dead

[code] // If killed apply dead

if ((absX >=3362 && absX <=3384 && absY >=3224 && absY <= 3240 && IsDead == true && NewHP <= 1)) {
IsDead = false;
playerLevel[3] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]);
currentHealth = playerLevel[3];
NewHP = playerLevel[3];
refreshSkills();
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
EntangleDelay = 0;
Poisoned = false;
teleportToX = 3374;
teleportToY = 9747;
sendMessage(“The glory of FunPK saves your items!”);
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: PLEASE HELP ME! (FunPK Bug)
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

In your youDied method add this at the top (if you are not using the variable ‘safe’ replace it with the name of yours):

if (safe > 0) { return; }

Read full topic
